The province: level policy enacted by British Columbia in 2015 that limits sales of wine in grocery stores to products made in British Columbia.
The U: S. Trade Representative's statement that British Columbia's rules discriminate against imported wine and provide a substantial competitive advantage for BC wine.
The Wine Institute: s assertion that discriminatory rules also exist in Ontario and Quebec.
The fact that the U: S. wine industry leads foreign wine sales in Canada, with the United States ranking first among all nations for imported wine sales in Canada and selling more wine to Canada than to any country other than the European Union.
